task.title: How to create large quotation marks in CSS
task.shortdesc: A modern form of blockquote styling is to indent the quoted text with a vertical line used as a border on the left. This indicates a quotation without too much decoration, making it ideal for professional documents.

steps.step: Open the CSS file that is linked to your HTML file in the text editor of your choosing.
To preview the styled text in your document, open the HTML file in a web browser.

Due to other CSS styling that may be in effect, check that the previewed blockquote output:
Appears distinctively from the body text.
Is readable against the background./li<
Displays a solid vertical line to the left of the quoted text.
Does not show any visible overlap of components.

If the output does not look meet those guidelines or the apearance is not to your satisfication:
Edit values within the blockquote selector of the CSS file. It is reccommended that you limit edits to one or two values at a time so that the changes are easier to manage.
Save the CSS file.
Preview the HTML document again.
Repeat these steps if necessary.

result.p: The HTML output will display blockquotes in the document with a line border according to CSS.
